'Isophthalic acid' is an organic compound with the formula
C 6H 4(CO 2H) 2. This colourless solid
is an isomer of phthalic acid and terephthalic acid. These aromatic dicarboxylic
acids are used as precursors (in form of acyl chlorides) to commercially
important polymers, e.g. the fire-resistant material Nomex. Mixed with
terephthalic acid, isophthalic acid is used in the production of resins for
drink bottles. The high-performance polymer polybenzimidazole is produced from
isophthalic acid. Richard J. Sheehan "Terephthalic Acid,
Dimethyl Terephthalate, and Isophthalic Acid" in Ullmann's Encyclopedia of
Industrial Chemistry, Wiley-VCH, Weinheim, 2005.
